trans-unit.source: Using the Slack Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the Slack Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the Slack Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the Slack Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the Slack Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the Slack Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect to Slack channels and post messages to your team.
trans-unit.target: Connect to Slack channels and post messages to your team.

trans-unit.source: Connectors can be used in Logic Apps as a part of a "workflow" to do different tasks.
trans-unit.target: Connectors can be used in Logic Apps as a part of a "workflow" to do different tasks.

trans-unit.source: When you use the Slack Connector in your workflow, you can achieve a variety of scenarios using other connectors.
trans-unit.target: When you use the Slack Connector in your workflow, you can achieve a variety of scenarios using other connectors.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can use the <link><linkText>Facebook Connector</linkText><title></title></link> in your workflow to post a message to your Slack channel.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can use the <link><linkText>Facebook Connector</linkText><title></title></link> in your workflow to post a message to your Slack channel.

trans-unit.source: Triggers and Actions
trans-unit.target: Triggers and Actions

trans-unit.source: Triggers are events that happen.
trans-unit.target: Triggers are events that happen.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an order is updated or when a new customer is added.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an order is updated or when a new customer is added.

trans-unit.source: An Action is the result of the trigger.
trans-unit.target: An Action is the result of the trigger.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an order is updated, send an alert to the salesperson.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an order is updated, send an alert to the salesperson.

trans-unit.source: Or, when a new customer is added, send a welcome email to the new customer.
trans-unit.target: Or, when a new customer is added, send a welcome email to the new customer.

trans-unit.source: The Slack Connector can be used as an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.
trans-unit.target: The Slack Connector can be used as an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.

trans-unit.source: Currently, there are no triggers available for the Slack Connector.
trans-unit.target: Currently, there are no triggers available for the Slack Connector.

trans-unit.source: The Slack Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:
trans-unit.target: The Slack Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:

trans-unit.source: Triggers
trans-unit.target: Triggers

trans-unit.source: Actions
trans-unit.target: Actions

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: Post Message
trans-unit.target: Post Message

trans-unit.source: Create the Slack connector
trans-unit.target: Create the Slack connector

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Select API Apps and search for “Slack Connector”.
trans-unit.target: Select API Apps and search for “Slack Connector”.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties:
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties:

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: Using the Connector as an Action in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the Connector as an Action in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: The connectors and Logic apps should always be created in the same resource group.
trans-unit.target: The connectors and Logic apps should always be created in the same resource group.

trans-unit.source: Once the Slack connector is created, you can add it as an action to your Logic App:
trans-unit.target: Once the Slack connector is created, you can add it as an action to your Logic App:

trans-unit.source: Within your Logic app, open Triggers and Actions.
trans-unit.target: Within your Logic app, open Triggers and Actions.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Create a new Logic App</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Create a new Logic App</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The Slack connector is listed in the gallery on the right hand side:
trans-unit.target: The Slack connector is listed in the gallery on the right hand side:

trans-unit.source: Select the Slack Connector you created to automatically add it to your logic app.
trans-unit.target: Select the Slack Connector you created to automatically add it to your logic app.

trans-unit.source: Select Authorize.
trans-unit.target: Select Authorize.

trans-unit.source: Sign-in to your Slack account.
trans-unit.target: Sign-in to your Slack account.

trans-unit.source: Towards the end, you are asked to give permission to your connector to access your Slack account.
trans-unit.target: Towards the end, you are asked to give permission to your connector to access your Slack account.

trans-unit.source: Select Authorizify:
trans-unit.target: Select Authorizify:

trans-unit.source: You can now use the Slack connector in the flow.
trans-unit.target: You can now use the Slack connector in the flow.

trans-unit.source: The Post Message action is available:
trans-unit.target: The Post Message action is available:

trans-unit.source: Lets walk through the "Post Message" experience.
trans-unit.target: Lets walk through the "Post Message" experience.

trans-unit.source: You can use this action to post a message to any Slack Channel:
trans-unit.target: You can use this action to post a message to any Slack Channel:

trans-unit.source: Configure the input properties for "Post Message" action:
trans-unit.target: Configure the input properties for "Post Message" action:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Text
trans-unit.target: Text

trans-unit.source: Enter the text of the message to be posted.
trans-unit.target: Enter the text of the message to be posted.

trans-unit.source: Channel Name
trans-unit.target: Channel Name

trans-unit.source: Enter the Slack Channel where this message is posted.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Slack Channel where this message is posted.

trans-unit.source: If the channel is not entered, then the message is posted to #general.
trans-unit.target: If the channel is not entered, then the message is posted to #general.

trans-unit.source: Advanced Properties
trans-unit.target: Advanced Properties

trans-unit.source: Bot User name: Name of the bot to use for this message. The message is posted as "Bot" if this is not entered.Icon URL: The image URL to use as the icon for this message.Icon Emoji: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. This property overrides the Icon URL property.
trans-unit.target: Bot User name: Name of the bot to use for this message. The message is posted as "Bot" if this is not entered.Icon URL: The image URL to use as the icon for this message.Icon Emoji: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. This property overrides the Icon URL property.

trans-unit.source: The Slack connector has REST APIs available so you can use the connector outside of a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: The Slack connector has REST APIs available so you can use the connector outside of a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Open your Slack Connector and select API definition:
trans-unit.target: Open your Slack Connector and select API definition:

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at <link><linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at <link><linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title></link>.
